etymologies: Latin, literally ‘from favor’, from ex ‘from’ and gratia (see grace)

definitions: (of payment) given as a favor or from a sense of moral obligation rather than because of any legal requirement

examples.text: generous companies may offer an ex gratia payment for employees with less than two years service

shortDefinitions: given from sense of moral obligation

definitions: (with reference to the payment of money) as a favor or from a sense of moral obligation rather than because of any legal requirement

examples.text: payments were made ex gratia to compensate for the loss of contractual entitlement

shortDefinitions: from sense of moral obligation rather than because of any legal requirement
